title: plugin-asterai: test config and test coverage
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

<!-- A clear and concise description of what the problem is. Ex. I'm always frustrated when [...] -->
The plugin-asterai package lacks comprehensive test coverage, which makes it difficult to ensure reliability and catch potential issues. 
**Describe the solution you'd like**

<!-- A clear and concise description of what you want to happen. -->
-Test coverage for all key functionalities:
Environment configuration validation
Query handling and responses
Error handling scenarios
Provider summary fetching and caching
Memory management through the knowledge manager
-Test organization improvements:
Clear test structure with describe/it blocks
Proper beforeEach setup for each test
Consistent mock implementations across test files

**Describe alternatives you've considered**

<!-- A clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered. -->

**Additional context**

<!-- Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here. -->

title: [V2] Move all models to runtime.call() and implement runtime.call() from v2-research
body:
Currently models are hardcoded into core as embedding, image model, text generation model, etc.

We have a new pattern in `v2-research` where the runtime calls an async function using `async runtime.call(functionName, functionParams)` -- we want to migrate this pattern to core and remove all hardcoded models, embedding providers, etc. Instead, handlers will be registered through plugins by function name. The first registered function will be called.

Stuff like this will go away completely:
```
export const EmbeddingProvider = {
    OpenAI: "OpenAI",
    Ollama: "Ollama",
    GaiaNet: "GaiaNet",
    Heurist: "Heurist",
    BGE: "BGE",
} as const;
```

title: [V2] Consolidate RagKnowledge and Knowledge
body: In the current core we have duplicate uses of RAG. knowledge.ts should serve all of our knowledge retrieval needs, and ragKnowledge.ts should get rolled up into this

title: A feature to collect information from Telegram group or Discord channel
body: I would like to collect information about communities in Telegram groups and Discord channels. Based on my review so far, it seems possible to infiltrate communities using bots or connect sessions with user accounts in the case of Telegram, but these methods are quite limited. It would be great if the Eliza-provided Agent could include an additional feature to collect community information and export it.

title: plugin anyone: test config and coverate
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
The plugin-anyone package lacks proper test coverage for its core functionality, specifically the startAnyone and stopAnyone actions. Without comprehensive tests, we couldn't ensure the reliability of the Anyone client and proxy service initialization/cleanup processes, making it difficult to catch potential issues before they affect production.
**Describe the solution you'd like**

<!-- A clear and concise description of what you want to happen. -->
- Add Vitest as testing framework
* Create __tests__ directory in package root
* Add tests for startAnyone and stopAnyone actions
* No use of undefined, unknown or other unsafe type casts
* Add basic vitest config
* Add test scripts to package.json:
    * test: Run tests once
    * test:watch: Run tests in watch mode
The tests should cover:
* Action validation
* Handler functionality
* Service initialization/cleanup
* Error handling
* Action metadata validation
**Describe alternatives you've considered**

<!-- A clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered. -->

**Additional context**

<!-- Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here. -->

title: Publish plugin-sui
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

We can't install plugin-sui because `@elizaos/plugin-sui is not in the npm registry, or you have no permission to fetch it.`

**Describe the solution you'd like**

Publish `plugin-sui` as npm registry

title: plugin-3d-generation: test config and test coverage
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

<!-- A clear and concise description of what the problem is. Ex. I'm always frustrated when [...] -->
The 3D generation plugin will need enhanced test coverage in several areas that will be important for future development:
1. The test suite will need to cover queue update callback functionality from the FAL API
2. There will be a need to test different types of 3D model responses (various file formats and sizes)
3. The error handling tests will need to be more specific about different types of API errors that could occur
**Describe the solution you'd like**

<!-- A clear and concise description of what you want to happen. -->
1. New test cases for queue updates will:
    * Test how progress updates will be handled during generation
    * Verify how queue position updates will be managed
    * Ensure cancellation scenarios will be properly handled
2. Additional test cases for different model formats will:
    * Verify how .glb files will be processed
    * Ensure .obj files will be handled correctly
    * Test how different file sizes will be managed
3. Enhanced error handling tests will:
    * Cover specific API error codes that might occur
    * Verify how network timeouts will be handled
    * Test how rate limiting will be managed
    * Ensure invalid API key formats will be properly detected
These improvements will make our test suite more comprehensive and will help catch edge cases before they become issues in production.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**

<!-- A clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered. -->

**Additional context**

<!-- Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here. -->

title: node-llama-cpp
body:
I continue getting this when following the install instructions and running `pnpm install --no-frozen-lockfile`

```
node_modules/canvas: Running install script...
node_modules/node-llama-cpp: Running postinstall script, failed in 2.4s
node_modules/node-llama-cpp postinstall$ node ./dist/cli/cli.js postinstall
└─ Failed in 2.4s at /eliza/node_modules/node-llama-cpp
```

Running on `Apple M1 Max 64 GB Sonoma`

I get the same issue on the main and latest branch 

There have been multiple issues created about this and suggested workarounds that I've tried but the error is still persisting. Is there a more official/consistent solution? Can the post install script be skipped outright?
